articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Tuesday a Hamas statement of support for a U.N. resolution backing a proposal for a ceasefire in the Gaza war was a "hopeful sign" though word from the militant group's leadership in the enclave was vital.
articles.title: Blinken says Hamas signal of support for UN-backed Gaza truce deal is 'hopeful sign'

articles.author: Tom Hals, Jack Queen
articles.description: President Joe Biden’s son Hunter Biden was convicted by a jury on Tuesday of lying about his drug use to illegally buy a gun, a verdict Democrats may seize upon to counter Donald Trump’s claim of a justice system weaponized against him.
articles.title: Hunter Biden found guilty of lying about drug use to buy gun

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's opposition left-wing parties late on Monday pledged to work together and nominate joint candidates in snap parliament elections later this month to challenge the government and Marine Le Pen's far-right movement.
articles.title: French left-wing parties pledge to team up for snap elections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mediators Egypt and Qatar received a response from Hamas and Palestinian groups to a U.S. ceasefire plan for Gaza, the Egyptian and Qatari governments said on Tuesday as an official briefed on the matter said Hamas proposed a new timeline.
articles.title: Hamas responds to Egypt, Qatar on Gaza ceasefire plan; source says group proposes new timeline

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The airplane carrying Malawi's Vice President Saulos Klaus Chilima may have crashed in dense forest, but it has not yet been found, the military said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Malawi vice president's plane may have crashed in forest, military says

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Group of Seven (G7) leaders will fly to southern Italy this week for their annual summit in downbeat mood, confronting myriad woes at home even as they seek solutions for many of the world's most pressing problems.
articles.title: Hamstrung at home, G7 leaders struggle to resolve global woes

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday named and shamed Israel's armed and security forces, Palestinian militants Hamas and Islamic Jihad, and Sudan's warring parties for killing and maiming children in 2023, adding them to an annual global list of offenders for violations against children.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas, Sudan rivals added to UN list for killing children

articles.author: Harold Isaac
articles.description: Haiti's administration picked new ministers on Tuesday, rounding out the new prime minister's cabinet, in a stark departure from the previous government as the country battles a deep humanitarian crisis fueled by armed gangs.
articles.title: Haiti names new cabinet, in strong shift from previous government
Pope repeats gay slur in closed-door meeting, ANSA reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Human Rights Commissioner said on Tuesday she had issued a fresh appeal to senior U.N. and other officials to take action to secure the release of Russian nationals still held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Russian rights commissioner calls for swift release of Russians held by Hamas
